account.kb.creation-form.anonymization.c: By enabling anonymization, personal information (people names, phone numbers, email addresses, bank account details, credit card number) will be permanently removed from any ingested data and therefore not searchable.
account.kb.creation-form.anonymization.d:
Anonymization ensures that any personal information, such as people names, phone numbers, email addresses, bank account details, or credit card numbers, present in the data you push to your Knowledge Box is automatically identified and removed.
Only apply anonymization for legal reasons (GDPR-compliant services), as it will impact your results and the removed data won’t be searchable. Read the documentation for more information.
account.kb.creation-form.description: A Knowledge Box is a container that stores and organizes data inside your Nuclia account. Knowledge Boxes represent isolated workspaces (such as projects, teams, or clients) and operate independently with their own access permissions to keep information secured and organized.

account.kb-description: A Knowledge Box is a collection of content that Nuclia searches on. Some search engines call it an "index" or "corpus".  In most cases, you only need one Knowledge Box for your application.

To prevent overspending on monthly consumables, we recommend setting a monthly economic limit.

Define the personality traits of the assistant, how it should behave when answering questions or during a conversation. For example, you could define that the system will answer as a health professional.
kb.ai-models.answer-generation.prompt.de: Defines the way you want the system to act when you ask a question. Here you can define more specific rules, that could even override the defined behavior. For example, you could set a prompt that makes the system only give results in lists, or even ask to answer in a given language.

prompt-lab.configuration.prompts.example:
Taking into account this context:
{context}
Give a detailed answer to this question:
{question} . 
If you do not find an answer in the context, say that you don't have enough data.

Taking into account this provided context.
    Context:
    {context}
    Answer this question like a medical professional.:
 "{question}"

search.configuration.delete-config-confi: This action cannot be undone. Deleting the configuration will delete its record in the saved configuration dropdown.
search.configuration.generative-answer.a: A slug contains only alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

The generative answer will use the entire text of this specific resource as context instead of the search results matching the query. Note: if the resource text content is too long, it might be shortened when passed to the LLM.
search.configuration.generative-answer.c: Customize the message displayed when there's insufficient data to generate a response to the user's question. This field allows HTML markup.
search.configuration.generative-answer.g: Generate a response to the user’s questions and allow to chat with the system. If you deselect this toggle the user will only get keywords and vector search results.
Use a different generative model than the default one defined in the Knowledge Box AI settings
search.configuration.generative-answer.l: Defines the maximum number of tokens that the model will generate. A low number may prevent your users to see results.
search.configuration.generative-answer.p: It will take precedence over the user prompt defined in the Knowledge Box settings. Note: the prompt strategy might change depending on the generative model.
search.configuration.generative-answer.r: Limit the amount of full resources that will be passed to the LLM
Passes entire resource as context when generating answers (instead of just the paragraphs retrieved by the search query)
Requires using OpenAI ChatGPT-Vision or Google Gemini Pro Vision.
Limit the quantity of images passed to the context from each page
Images extracted from the pages containing the matching paragraphs will be added to the context.
Images extracted from the matching paragraphs will be added to the context.
One field id per line. The field ids have to be in the format {field_type}/{field_name}, like 'a/title', 'a/summary' for title and summary fields or 't/amend' for a text field named 'amend'.
Passes specific fields (designated by their ids) along with the paragraphs retrieved by the search query
Each paragraph will be preceded by the title of the resource and its summary (if defined), and followed by a number of additional characters.
Rephrase the query in order to obtain better vector search results. (Note: the query is unchanged regarding keyword search)
search.configuration.generative-answer.s: Vector search results & full text results
Select which results are used to generate the answer
search.configuration.loading-error: An error occurred while loading search configurations
search.configuration.modification-warnin: The current configuration is different from the selected one, click save to save a new configuration.
search.configuration.result-display.disp: Display a section listing all the fields of the resource in the right sidebar of the viewer. This section is only visible for resources containing multiple fields.
Metadata are displayed under the title of each resource.
Show all results from the search
Paragraphs used to generate the answer
Search results are displayed under the answer.
Thumbnails are a preview of the resource.
search.configuration.result-display.rela: Displays information about NERs in the search results. Cannot be used with the "Match synonyms" option.
Shows all the relations between entities for a given resource in the viewer.
search.configuration.result-display.sect: Choose what to show in the results.
Please save or reset the search configuration before creating a widget.
search.configuration.save-config-modal.d: Give a name to your search configuration to find it again.
search.configuration.search-box.automati: Detects entities mentioned in the user query and turns them automatically into filters.
Filtering will be based on the origin.created value if provided in the resource, otherwise it will default to the resource creation date (created).
Please note: all resources created before 2023-11-02 will have to be reprocessed for origin.created to be filterable.
The user will be able to apply filters to the search.
search.configuration.search-box.placehol: Change the text that you want to appear in the search bar when not active. The default text is “Type your question here”.
search.configuration.search-box.preselec: Filter format documented here. These filters will be applied to any search queries without being visible to the end users.
Define filters that will be applied by default to any query.
search.configuration.search-box.querypre: This text will be inserted before the user's query. It allows to define a specific context, so the search results are accurate even though the user is not specifiying what they are asking about.
search.configuration.search-box.suggesti: Suggest labels based on the query
Suggest NERs to autocompleting the search query
They’ll be visible under the search box.
search.configuration.search-box.synonyms: Match synonyms in fuzzy search. This feature cannot be used with the "Relations" option.

search.widgets.dialog.delete-widget.desc: This action cannot be undone. Deleting the widget will delete it’s record in your widgets list, but existing embed of the code on your website won’t be affected.
search.widgets.dialog.duplicate-as-new.d: Create a new widget with the same configuration, you can edit it in the next step.
search.widgets.form.description: The embedded widget will reflect the search configuration and widget options set below.
search.widgets.form.widget-options.hide-: Only available for growth and enterprise plans.

When using Nuclia to search web pages, clicking on a result will open the original page rather than rendering it in the viewer.
search.widgets.form.widget-options.perma: Adds extra parameters to the URL so that users can copy and share a direct link to a specific resource or search results.
search.widgets.form.widget-options.secti: Define the look and behavior of the widget.
search.widgets.form.widget-options.style: Popup modal style (opens above your content)
search.widgets.form.widget-options.theme: Select the theme of the widget
search.widgets.page-description: Create and manage search widgets to embed in your projects.

stash.publish.confirm: Publishing a Knowledge Box means it will be accessible to anyone in the world.  It  might be indexed by public search engines such as Google.

stash.publish.title: Publish Knowledge Box
stash.publish.warning: If you publish the "{{ kb }}" Knowledge Box, all the information in it will be public.

stash.title: Title of the box
stash.upload.go-to-synchronize: To synchronize data from third-party sources or local folders, head to the Synchronize section.
stash.upload.page-subtitle: You can directly upload your files, links, resources or folder
stash.upload.sync.description: Select a source and pick folders you’d like to automatically push to your current Knowledge Box.
stash.upload.sync.setup: Or set up a Sync Agent to use the Synchronization feature and automatically push data from:
stash.upload.sync.title: Synchronization
stash.upload_to_search: Upload data to start using the AI-search engine.
stash.valid_domains: Domains whose email will be accepted. (Comma-separated)
stash.valid_domains_label: Domains from which email can be sent
stash.valid_emails: Add, separated by comas, the emails addresses from witch emails will be accepted.
synonyms.confirm-deletion.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{{word}}" and its synonyms "{{synonyms}}"?
synonyms.confirm-deletion.title: Delete synonym?
synonyms.page-description: Use synonyms to enhance full text search in technical documentation
tasks-automation.errors.counting-labeled: An error occurred while counting the resources labeled with the selected label set.
tasks-automation.errors.counting-resourc: An error occurred while counting the resources matching the task configuration.
tasks-automation.form.apply-task-to.auto: Apply automatically to all existing and future resources
tasks-automation.form.apply-task-to.desc: Keep the task running for future resources or run it once.
tasks-automation.form.apply-task-to.titl: What do you want the task to apply to?
tasks-automation.form.field-name.label: Name the field
tasks-automation.form.filter.description: The action will apply only to resources matching the selection.
tasks-automation.form.filter.title: Filter the resources
tasks-automation.form.label-set-selectio: Select the label set that you want to use to label resources.
Select the label set that you want to use to label text blocks.
{{count}} resources are labeled with the labels from this label set.
{{count}} text blocks are labeled with the labels from this label set.
tasks-automation.form.labeling-options.d: Specify the source for the automatic labeling of your resources.
Specify the source for the automatic labeling of your text blocks.
tasks-automation.form.labeling-options.e: Apply labels based on existing labeling
You need to make sure that enough resources are labeled with the selected label set in order to obtain satisfactory results.
You need to make sure that enough text blocks are labeled with the selected label set in order to obtain satisfactory results.
tasks-automation.form.labeling-options.p:
Write labels between {brackets}, new labels will be automatically added to the selected label set.

Example: Add label {Large contract} for invoices exceeding $10,000 and label {Small contract} for invoices under $10,000.

Write labels between {brackets}, new labels will be automatically added to the selected label set.

Example: Add label {X} for every textblock containing information about X.
Using prompt may produce unexpected results.
Using prompt may produce unexpected results.
tasks-automation.form.llm-selection.desc: The chosen LLM will perform the task.
tasks-automation.form.llm-selection.warn: By using this LLM, you’ll consume {{X}} tokens everytime the task runs.
tasks-automation.form.webhook.descriptio: Whenever the trigger event is happening, Nuclia will make POST call to the given URL, passing the given headers (if any).
tasks-automation.form.webhook.title: Trigger & webhook
tasks-automation.global-question.descrip: Enrich your resources by automatically asking the same question to chosen resources.
tasks-automation.global-question.field-n: The generated data is stored within a new field in the respective resources.
A new field will be created in each resource containing the question & answer to your global query.
Where to find the question and answer?
Apply your question to all existing and future resources matching the selection.
Apply your question to {{count}} existing resources only.
tasks-automation.global-question.title: Ask global question
tasks-automation.global-question.trigger: For each resource processed with the question and answer
tasks-automation.global-question.your-qu: The question will be applied to all the resources of the selection and answers will be generated in a new field.
Examples: "What is the contract end date?" or "Does the document contains information about X?"
tasks-automation.label-ners.description: Automate NER to help classify tokens in your resources.
tasks-automation.label-ners.detection-op: Specify the source for the automatic detection of NER.
Apply detection based on manually annotated tokens with NER
{{count}} tokens are currently labeled with this NER family.
You need to make sure that the selected NER family has been used to annotate content, if it's not the case you'll have to first annotate text manually with the NER family in at least one resource.

Write NER family between {brackets}, any new NER family will be automatically added.

Example: Add NER {X} for every instance of the word “X”.
Use a prompt to define NER detection
Using prompt may produce unexpected results.
tasks-automation.label-ners.find-ners.de: The NER are applied to tokens within the resource itself.
tasks-automation.label-ners.find-ners.in: Navigate to the resource then to Annotate with NER
tasks-automation.label-ners.footer.apply: Label all existing and future resources matching the selection.
tasks-automation.label-ners.title: Annotate tokens with Named Entity Recognition (NER)
tasks-automation.label-ners.trigger-desc: For each resource processed with the automatic NER detection
tasks-automation.label-resources.descrip: Automate the annotation of resources with labels to help classify your resources.
tasks-automation.label-resources.find-la: The resource labels can be displayed in the resource list view and in the resource itself.
See & edit in each resource: Annotate with labels > Resource field
Display the labels in Resource list: Displayed columns > Labels
Where to find the resource’s labels?
Label all existing and future resources matching the selection.
tasks-automation.label-resources.title: Label resources
tasks-automation.label-resources.trigger: For each resource processed with the automatic labeling
tasks-automation.label-text-blocks.descr: Automate the annotation of text blocks with labels to help classify text blocks in your resources.
tasks-automation.label-text-blocks.find-: The text block labels of each resource are stored within the resources themselves.
Navigate to the resource then to Annotate with Label
Where to find the text blocks labels?
tasks-automation.label-text-blocks.foote: Label all existing and future resources matching the selection.
Label text blocks of {{count}} existing resources only.
tasks-automation.label-text-blocks.title: Label text blocks
tasks-automation.label-text-blocks.trigg: For each resource processed with the automatic labeling
tasks-automation.page-description: Improve the performance and precision of your search experience by running automated tasks on your Knowledge Box.
tasks-automation.question-answer.descrip: Enrich your resources by automatically adding questions & answers to them.
tasks-automation.question-answer.field-n: The generated data is stored within a new field in the respective resources.
A new field will be created in each resource containing the questions & answers generated.
Where to find the questions and answers?
Generate questions & answers for all existing and future resources matching the selection.
Generate questions & answers for {{count}} existing resources only.
tasks-automation.question-answer.title: Generate questions & answers
tasks-automation.question-answer.trigger: For each resource processed with the automatic questions & answers
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.add: With prompts you can specify the tone, format, or scope.
Example : Write summary in a professional tone, use bullet point to highlight the structure of the document.
Using prompt may produce unexpected results.
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.des: Automate the creation of summary for your resources.
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.fin: The summary of each resource is stored within a new field in the resource.
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.foo: Summarize all existing and future resources matching the selection.
Apply summarization to {{count}} existing resources only.
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.sum: What type of summary do you want to generate?
tasks-automation.summarize-resources.tri: For each resource with a summary generated
upload.advanced.language-detection.check: Let Nuclia automatically detect the language
upload.advanced.language-detection.input: Use specified language when processing the files uploaded
upload.advanced.processing.aitable.help: It converts table contents into MarkDown that can be used by a LLM.
upload.advanced.processing.aitable.label: Interpret tables
upload.advanced.processing.help: Nature-specific processing is longer and generate more costs than regular processing.
upload.advanced.processing.invoice.label: Process invoices
upload.advanced.processing.none.label: None
upload.advanced.processing.table.help: It extracts tables as images so they can be processed by a visual LLM.
upload.advanced.processing.table.label: Extract tables
upload.advanced.processing.title: Specific processings
upload.advanced.title: Options
upload.csv_css_selector: CSS selector column is mandatory, but you can keep it empty if you don't need it.
upload.csv_description: Create multiple resources by selecting a CSV file with 4 columns: Title, Body, Format, Labels
upload.csv_format: Format column must be one of these values: PLAIN / MARKDOWN / KEEP_MARKDOWN /HTML / RST
upload.csv_links_description: Select a CSV file with 3 columns: Url, Labels, CSS selector
upload.invalid_image: Selected file is not a valid image
upload.limit-exceeded: Too many uploads. Try again in a moment.
upload.limit-warning: Your account is processing over {{limit}} resources simultaneously, which may lead to errors or limitations. Please wait for the queue to decrease or upload at a slower rate.
upload.once_uploaded: Once uploaded, you can see the status of your files in the Pending resources page. When the files are processed, they will show up in the Resources list.
upload.qna_csv_description: Create a Q&A resource by selecting a CSV file with 2 columns: Question, Answer
upload.qna_csv_preview.question: Question
upload.select_file: Drop your file(s) or click here
upload.size_warning_1: Media files can not exceed {{ maxMedia }} and non-media files {{ max }}.
upload.size_warning_2: Files exceeding those sizes will not be uploaded
upload.takes_time: We need some time to process the files. Feel free to close this dialog box and keep working.
upload.toast.limit: Your account has been issuing too many requests over a short period. Try again in a moment.
upload.uploading_files: Uploading files. Feel free to use Nuclia in the meantime
upload.use_folder_as_labels.help: First-level folder is the label set name, subfolders are labels. If subfolders are nested, files will get multiple labels. Labels will be created automatically if they are not defined in the Knowledge Box yet.
upload.use_folder_as_labels.label: Use folder names as label names
upload.warning-archive-description:
Archive files (like .zip, .tar, etc.) are supported, but take note that all the files contained in an archive will be gathered in a single resource.

If you expect to get separated results when searching, it is better to extract the files and upload them as separate files.
upload.warning-archive-title: You are about to upload {{num}} archive files
upload.warning-spreadsheet-title: You are about to upload {{num}} spreadsheet files
upload.warning-spreadsheets-description: The embeddings indexing of these files might not be optimal depending on their format and structure. See the documentation for more information.
welcome.reader: You were invited to {{title}} Knowledge Box as a Reader; you can consult resources and perform search operations.
welcome.start: Where would you like to start?
welcome.title: Welcome, {{name}}!
welcome.writer: You were invited to {{title}} Knowledge Box as a Writer; you can upload and consult resources, and perform search operations.
